alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Muskogee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 10:33PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SEQUOYAH... SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM CST... At 1032 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Pumpkin Center to 4 miles northeast of Warner. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Warner... Gore... Webbers Falls... Braggs... Cookson... Cherokee Landing State Park... Greenleaf State Park... Pumpkin Center... Lake Tenkiller State Park... Box... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 277 and 279. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
